snippet: A storm that meteorologists said could be the largest of the winter — at least in terms of geographical size if not precipitation or temperature — headed from the South to the North.
abstract: Second major ice storm in two weeks freezes Atlanta in place, although the city is more prepared than it was for the previous snowstorm; other parts of the South are less prepared.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Alan Blinder from Peachtree Corners, Ga., John Peragine from Asheville, N.C., Cynthia Howle from Oxford, Miss., Steven Yaccino from Chicago, Jack Healy from Denver, Emmarie Huetteman from Washington, Nate Schweber from Newark and Eli Rosenberg from New York.

lead_paragraph: A storm that meteorologists said could be the largest of the winter — at least in terms of geographical size if not precipitation or temperature — headed from the South to the North.

headline.main: Atlanta Frozen Again as Winter Woes Chill South
headline.print_headline: Atlanta Frozen Again as Winter Woes Chill South
